p: As shown in Table 1, analysis of the essential oil resulted in identification of 44 compounds, representing 98.40% of the total oil, with carvone (49.5%), limonene (16.1%), 1,8-cineole (8.7%), cis-dihydrocarvone (3.9%), β-caryophyllene (2.7%), germacrene D (2.1%) and β-pinene (1.1%) were the predominating components. The most abundant chemical structure within components was the oxygenated monoterpenes (67.2%), followed by monoterpene hydrocarbons (20.8%), sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (7.5%) and oxygenated sesquiterpenes (1.2%).
